page.title: 01Landscape and Settlements
page.content: Two thirds of our area is sea and one third is land. Most of the land area is open spaces. The main settlement is {Silloth, }which has a population of 2,789 including {Skinburness }and {Blitterlees.} Silloth was first built in the 1850's round a dock and railway which ran from {Carlisle. }The railway is now closed but the dock still operates. Silloth streets are set out like a gridiron pattern and they are named after geographical features - rivers and mountains, etc. There is a large Green and a long Promenade which runs up to Skinburness Village to the North. To the South is{ West Silloth which is mostly a council estate - The Crofts. The rest of the area is open land and farms except for several small settlements like {Blitterlees, {Causewayhead}etc.
